instructions:
Wash beans, cover with water 1 inch above beans and soak over night. Drain beans, add fresh water,
cover and bring slowly to a boil. Simmer over low heat for 1 hour or until beans are tender. Drain, reserving
2/3 cup of bean liquid.
Dredge beef cubes in flour and brown with butter in hot frying pan. Remove and set aside. Sauté onions,
green pepper and garlic for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes, chili powder, brown sugar, salt, pepper and vinegar.
Mix well, add beans and half of reserved bean liquid. Pour into a one quart baking dish and top with beef
cubes. Cover and bake in 350 F oven for 1 1/2 hours. Uncover and bake an additional 15 minutes. Add
remaining bean liquid as necessary during baking. Serves 3.
ingredients: 1/2 lb top round steak, cut in 1 inch cubes
1 can (15 oz) stewed tomatoes, cut up
name: Rancho Bean Casserole
